description.narrative: By 2019, the MENESRS (central and deconcentrated level) has an educational policy covering all sub-sectors and based on evidence, equity, risk analysis and vulnerabilities, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children of pre-primary and primary age (girls and boys), and especially those living in the most disadvantaged areas, complete the relevant cycle for their age.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, the MENESRS (central and deconcentrated level) has an educational policy covering all sub-sectors and based on evidence, equity, risk analysis and vulnerabilities

description.narrative: Key milestone was reached with the availability of strategic documents (RESEN, ESP roadmap) for the development of the Education Sector Plan 2020-2029. UNICEF supported the initial establishment of the official Task Force, to lead the development of the ESP. UNICEF contributed to holding of participatory ESP consultations in-country under the supervision of World Bank. Since 2016, UNICEF supported MEPS to produce its Education Statistics Yearbooks to avail data for assessing efficiency of the education sector, planning and for policy decisions. UNICEF contributed to ongoing policy dialogue with the organization of an Education Joint Sector Review in September 2019. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Availability of an education sector plan covering all sub-sectors and based on equity, gender, analysis and risk management and vulnerabilities

actual.value: 2019:ESP is underway and Roadmap was instrumental for this stage of the process.

title.narrative: Availability of an Education Information and Management System providing disaggregated data to identify disparities and monitor implementation of the sector plan
